2. What drives you to make films?:

Probably ego, attention, insecurities etc.

3. Where in the world would you most like to be right now?:

Scotland and/or Germany where my films will be screening very soon.

4. When inspiration is waning, and you feel creatively sapped, what do you do to stay motivated?:

I just keep working. Eventually something does happen. I treat it like any other job I’ve ever had. Thatâs usually the best way.

5. What films are the most inspiring or influential to you at the moment, and why?:

7. What’s the scariest thing you’ve ever done?:

Drive.

8. What’s your greatest extravagance?:

Stationery.

9. What turns you on – creatively, spiritually or emotionally?:

A typical vacation or being alone for a while.

The 16mm film program Leslie Raymond is presenting from the last Ann Arbor Film Festival. I was there with FOREIGN QUARTERS so I saw most of those films. The ones I saw were really good.
